comment: Gratuitously overpriced. This would be excellent at $30, but that would compete with Beam's other offerings.
A lighter sweet flavor with very little lingering taste. Easy drinking.
Christmas 2014 present from my parents. Pretty smooth.
Interesting vanilla flavor. Burn last a while but was mild.
Nose & pallet strong fruit & spice notes. Finish is short I hound it to herbal & vanilla
A close friend or mine introduced us... Slight maple with hints of and clove vanilla.. Very smooth. Had it neat and mixed.. I believe it deserves a better grade..
Severely underrated. Shines on ice and works really well in cocktails. Only worth picking up one sale though.
Pretty decent. Defiantly would drink again. Fairly smooth.
Spicy. Would be really nice in a cocktail, but prefer traditional bourbon for sipping.
Spicy! Immediate punch with a consistent tase that disappears all at once!
sweet middle bight, strong finish caramel, vanilla

It's ok.  It's a good sipper, but it has no character.  It's a straight middle of the road rye, with the standard vanilla and dried fruit notes you would expect from about any rye or high-rye bourbon.
It has come to my attention, that I had purchased that bottle at a steep discount below the normal retail price (usually $40+).  Even at the price I paid, I wouldn't purchase it again, and definitely not at full retail.
Not far from bourbon kind of rye.  not oppressive with spice, lots of vanilla.  works well neat or in a blend.
Bit of spice makes this unique. Not the best but you could do worse.
